titles.title: Ludlow Massacre National Historic Landmark Act
A bill to designate the Ludlow Massacre National Historic Landmark in the State of Colorado, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

bill.summary: 4/18/2008--Introduced. Ludlow Massacre National Historic Landmark Act - Designates the Ludlow Tent Colony Site (a site where striking miners and their families lived during the 1913-1914 Colorado coal strike) in Las Animas County, Colorado, as the "Ludlow Massacre National Historic Landmark."
